newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian Bank Rossiisky Credit gets credit extended.
newsitem.headline: Russian Bank Rossiisky Credit gets credit extended.

text.p: A syndicate of 18 European and U.S. banks led by Raiffeisen Zentralbank Oesterreich extended a credit to Russian Rossiisky Kredit bank, the Russian bank said.
The $21 million credit initially signed last September was extended for 180 days with a volume of $33 million and the right to be extended, Rossiisky Kredit said in a statement.
The interest rate for the credit is LIBOR plus 4.75 percent, it said.
In February Rossiisky Kredit signed a similar $50 million credit with a consortium of Western banks led by London Forfaiting Company.
Both credits were extended without coverage.
